name: Sandos Finisterra Los Cabos

reviews.text: This was my first time in Cabo and I was nervous about where I was going to stay. I found that the Hotel Finisterra was a nice place for those visiting Cabo for the first time. It is very close to downtown (within walking distance) and very close to the Marina should you do any water activities. I booked a standard room and it was HUGE almost bigger than my own apartment. It had a nice view of the pool and the ocean. It also had a nice balcony. I found the hotel to be quiet and the staff to be reasonably nice. A word to the wise, buy your own water at a store downtown because the bottled water is very expensive at the hotel. Their tap water is purified but it still tastes a little funny. I liked that they had huge pools and a choice of pools for those who really wanted to swim, lounge, or play volleyball with the kids. They also have nice hammocks on the beach. What I did not like was that even though you had access to the beach and it was pretty, there was no swimming cause the water is too dangerous. Also in the lobby near the concierge, there is a desk with a representative for a time share. This person WOULD NOT LEAVE ME ALONE!! I found myself trying to use different exits to avoid them harrassing me to go on their "free breakfast". They make it sound like the deal of the century but TRUST ME, do not do it. IT WILL SUCK UP AN ENTIRE DAY AND RUIN PART OF YOUR TRIP!! Also the hotel is about 40 min to 90 min from the airport depending on transportation. PLEASE AVOID THE TIME SHARE AGENTS AT THE AIRPORT PROMISING YOU MONEY BACK AND A FREE SHUTTLE IF YOU GO TO THE PRESENTATION. THESE MEN WERE AGGRESSIVE, SCARY, AND SHOULD BE KICKED OUT OF THE AIRPORT. THEY ARE ESPECIALLY AGGRESSIVE WITH FEMALE TRAVELERS SO BEWARE. JUST KEEP SAYING NO AND WALK AWAY. TAKE THE SHUTTLE AND PAY 15 OR TAKE A CAB AND PAY $60, JUST STAY AWAY FROM THESE AGENTS, THEY ARE HORRIBLE AND A LITTLE SCARY. Other than that it is a decent hotel. I wouldn't stay there again just because I want to be able to swim on the beach where I stay but if you are into pools, you can stay there.
reviews.title: Nice for First Timers to Cabo but Beware

likes.disliked: — The Horrible Time Share Representative in the lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading a majority of pleasant reviews there were a few negative ones as well; which made me a little nervous but we got a great deal for this place on our anniversary so we went for it.
reviews.title: Nice, clean hotel in a prime spot

reviews.text: Hotel: I must say that my boyfriend and I only have nice things to say about this hotel. Everyone was friendly and were there to assist you with what you needed. We were looking for a quiet hotel to relax in since it was our anniversary. If we wanted the more crazy scene we would go seek it out elsewhere! It is definetly not the place for you if you want a party-club scene hotel. The driveway is a rather large hill. We walked up it once and thought we were big shots...but took the free shuttle every single time afterwards. It runs 24-7. You can't swim on the beach in front of the hotel. The pacific ocean is roaring and it is for your safety.
reviews.title: Best location in Cabo

likes.liked: — location, location,location! room cleanlines, pools Whale watcher bar-a must!!!!
likes.disliked: — beds -ask for extra pillows, it helps!

reviews.text: Room: The room looked exactly like the photos. It was spacious VERY clean and large. (We stayed in an ocean view room in the newer section). Neither of us would consider the decor 'dated' in any way.
reviews.title: Loved the Finistera Despite a Few Problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pools & Blue Marlin: Pools are beautiful! There are many pools and many hot tubs so it never seemed crowded. Swim up bars and the palapa where you can order food are very cool. We ate at the blue marlin or bfast every morning, and dinner for a few of our nights before we discovered other places. It has good food, the dinner can add up pretty quick. For two our average dinner there ran to $70 (we didn't even order drinks).
reviews.title: Perfect location with stunning marina and ocean views!

reviews.text: I was heading to Cabo to meet some friends and needed a nice hotel, near downtown, and on the beach...Hotel Finisterra was my choice and exceeded my expectations in all regards.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Great Location!

reviews.text: This hotel was one of the first hotels in Cabo, and the orginial piece is situated on a picturesque rock cliff overlooking the pacific ocean. I booked in the new section which is down closer to the beach and pools. The views are terrific, the rooms are large, modern, and very nice.
reviews.title: Great except for the cockroaches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rate in the shoulder reason was very reasonable, as Cabo itself is an expensive destination. This hotel is on the pacific side, which means the current makes this a non-swimming beach. But no matter how many vacations I go on, I rarely swim in the ocean, I just like to be near it, so this didn't bother me.
reviews.title: Finisterra - nice but construction next door

reviews.text: It is a short walk to town, though some might take a taxi if you are with a girl who decides to wear heals...why she had to do that I don't know, but it was sandals the rest of the trip for her.
reviews.title: Finisterra overall was good!

reviews.text: Make sure you go up to the whale watcher bar in the old part of the hotel. It has majestic views of the pacific, although they are a little marred by the new construction going on. It would have been amazing to be there during the days of Hemingway.
reviews.title: Nice hotel!

likes.liked: — The pool area and the location to the harbour/bars/restaurants
likes.disliked: — The exterior and some rooms need desparate need to refurbishment

reviews.text: We love the Hotel Finisterra For its Location (with in walking distant of the harbor and town.) and its great pool area and beach. It was not a all-Inclusive at the time we were there but the bar food and drinks were good. I have been to the Hotel Finisterra Twice.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: I recently (11/15 to 11/22) stayed at the Finisterra and had a very good experience. The room was very clean and the hotel seems to be well maintained.
reviews.title: Great Experience

likes.liked: — Close proximity to the central marina area that negates the need for a frequent taxi.

reviews.text: I was there with my father who is approaching 70 and, at times, the walk up the hill was a challenge for him when the hotel van was not at the bottom of the hill to shuttle guests to the main building.
reviews.title: Nice place, but ...

reviews.text: I went fishing on multiple days and the hotel offered to keep my fish in the main freezer free of charge. The bellman retrieved it for me on my last day.
reviews.title: LOVE this place!!!

likes.liked: — Perfect location, cozy atomsphere, and awesome pools.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar and food prices were reasonable and the hotel offered a very competitive exchange rate for USD.
reviews.title: Nirvana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location within walking distance to Cabo nightlife, shopping and restaurants. Try to get the newer building that is closer to the ocean. The older building is cheaper but you can only see the other building and no ocean. The Whale Watcher bar had good strong drinks (unlike the pool drinks) and you really can watch the whales. The room was clean and nicely decorated. We had an excellent view overlooking the pool area and the pacific. The pool area is nice. It is quite a party place during spring break season. Expect to see lots of drunk minors. You cannot swim in this part of the ocean. There's plenty of nice sand for beach walks and sandcastles, but no going in the water. The rip currents are too dangerous on the pacific side. If you want ocean swimming stay on the bay or sea of cortez side.
reviews.title: Great Cabo spot

likes.disliked: — A bit too much of a party scene for us. No ocean swimming.

reviews.title: Memorable Experience
reviews.text: In Cabo be careful of theft. Also, if you rent wave runners they are a blast, but Mexico has not rules so they can be quite dangerous. I was hit by another wave runner and spent the week with with huge black and blue bruises all down my left side. I got lucky.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: San Jose del Cabo is a smaller city not far from Cabo San Lucas. It is much more family oriented and is known for some great local artwork. Also a two hour bus ride can take you to Todos Santos where the real Hotel California is (from the Eagle's song). The Hotel California will set you back about $350 a night. It is a beautiful, enchanting hotel. The food there is excellent! Todos Santos is a small town with more great local art and some excellent surfing beaches.
reviews.title: Great Place in Cabo

reviews.text: We were greeted by the warm and welcoming staff and to me and my boyfriends suprise, we were given a complimentary bottle of wine at the hotel restaurant. The staff was always willing to help, very friendly!
reviews.title: Pros and Cons
Nice hotel for a reasonable price!!
reviews.text: The rooms were nice, especially the view. Don't mind the bedding because it's worth it to have a view of the ocean. The view is much better than other hotels who have a bay view because you are actually staring out at a beautiful ocean with ocassional boats, instead of staring out a busy bay that is full of jet skiers, water taxis, and CRUISE SHIPS! Not once was anything ever missing from our room, which is ALWAYS a good thing! Also, the hotels breakfast was memorabily delicious! And for you females who worry about this like I do, I NEVER saw ANY bugs in our room! :)

description: Landmark Resort. Best location in town with Ocean and Bay views. CURRENTLY UNDER RENNOVATIONS IN SOME AREAS AWAY FORM GUESTS TRAFFIC, OPERATING ALL POOLS AND GUESTS ROOMS AND PUBLIC AREAS. Located in the “Heart and Soul of Cabo”!Live the legend of the new SANDOS Finisterra ALL INCLUSIVE RESORT unique architecture overlooking the Bay of San Lucas or enjoy the largest family rooms facing the Pacific sunsets in any of our Jr. Suites. All within a short walk to restaurants, night life, shops, fishing and water sports. Free WiFi in Lobby and Restaurants. Endless beach walks and amazing pools. Embrace the Cabo sun in any of our three amazing pools or have a snack at the largest and tallest Palapa in the Pacific. For the evenings enjoy a margarita at the historical Blue Marlin Bar where Keith Richards and Brooke Shields loved to relax. If you like tennis we have 2 courts for you free of charge. Ideal for Families or Couples that want the best value. The Jr. Suites Ocean View rooms have the largest capacity in Cabo sleeping 3 adults and 2 children with our 2 Queen and Sofa beds. Just perfect for the family that needs best value for their money!
